intro: Anthericum ericetorum, commonly known as the marsh helleborine, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the orchid family (Orchidaceae). It is characterized by its tall, erect stems that bear dark green, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces striking, hooded flowers that are typically greenish-yellow with purple markings. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and wet meadows. Anthericum ericetorum is often found in temperate regions of Europe and is notable for its ability to form dense colonies in suitable habitats.
